title: why does game development still involve coding? like at all?
body:
i legitimately dont understand how coding is still part of game development at all...

it actually feels like we've gone a step back to be honest, i feel that the warcraft map editor is about as close as we've ever come to the future of game development (or the portal map editor if you will).

i am currently messing with unreal engine and im speechless with how much less elegant it is than i expected. i feel we've reached the point where so many games have been done to where we should be able to find the tools to make our own games with almost no coding knowledge for most games, and limited coding knowledge for extremely rare case of wanting to do something that hasnt been done before...

sadly i cant see this happening...i think the only company that can even put a foot forward in the right direction would be Valve. and it would require them to talk to each of the devs of the games on steam and have them provide the tools used to make the games, maybe even charge for art assets and so on. but overall have a game engine and have it require no coding knowledge....

i have some coding knowledge, so im hanging in there learning what i can with unreal and some other engines but its too time consuming to do as a hobby. i have no will to dedicate my life to it, but i would of liked to try a traditional dungeon crawler or something...
